source.value_in_paper: ρd = 3.27 g cm−3 for Cryst. forsterite (Mg2SiO4)

optical_constants.format: ASCII .dat (space-separated, 3 columns) and CSV copies (comma-separated with header).

solid.type: total vapor pressure / phase-equilibrium vapor pressure pv

reference.notes: Temp. range is listed as the range for which A and B were determined.

hkl_mass_flux.equation: J(T) = α pv(T) sqrt( μ m_u / (2π k_B T) )
hkl_mass_flux.mu_note: Table 3 lists μ as molecular weight of the dust compound; van Lieshout et al. note this is an approximation.

converted_for_simulation.derivation: From pv = exp(−A/T + B) dyn cm−2; P(Pa)=0.1 pv; log10 P = ((B − ln 10) − A/T)/ln 10.

liquid.type: total vapor pressure (saturated vapor) in equilibrium with molten forsterite

original_equation.log_base: UNKNOWN (paper prints 'log' but does not define its base; natural log is explicitly written as 'ln' elsewhere)

reference.notes: Text states Eq. (5) gives the total pressure (bar) of the saturated vapor in equilibrium with molten forsterite.

assumptions: Conditional conversion: only if the 'log' in Eq.(5) is interpreted as log10 (base-10).
1 bar = 1e5 Pa so log10 P(Pa) = log10 P(bar) + 5.
converted_for_simulation.note: Derived directly from Eq.(5) interpreted as log10 P(bar).

notes: Use solid-vapor-pressure fit below T_melt_K and liquid-vapor-pressure fit at/above T_melt_K.
Solid fit validity is constrained by the temperature range in van Lieshout et al. (2014) Table 3.
Liquid fit validity is constrained by the derivation range stated next to Eq. (5) in Fegley & Schaefer (2012).
phase_switch.T_condense_solid_note: Operational choice: set equal to T_melt_K (no hysteresis) to satisfy simulation requirement; not claimed as a physical condensation temperature.
